text:
On this day in Trump history, March 18th, 2020, he declared himself a "wartime president" and promised "total victory" against what he referred to as the "Chinese virus"

#polisky

On this day in Trump history, March 18, 2018, Trump spent several hours Tweeting about the Mueller probe.. referring to the probe as a Witch Hunt, accusing James Comey of lying under oath, questioning Andrew McCabe's integrity... #polisky

NEW: This week's instalment of 'Stop, Look, and Listen', my weekly digest of recommended articles and podcasts, as part of my Academic Bubble newsletter. All reposts much appreciated. (1/6)
#skystorians 🗃️ #polisky #filmsky #dictatorsky

In a fortnight I’m off to Chicago / MPSA24! Polisky people, is anyone up for grabbing coffee or a beer to chat about comparative politics, political institutions, or democracy? Also, seeking suggestions for a day-trip in the Midwest (I already did Milwaukee & Madison/WI) www.mpsanet.org/conference/

Looking for #Women'sHistoryMonth events? Of course you are! 

I'll be talking about the history of women voters at a webinar hosted by Cambridge University Press tomorrow (Tuesday) at 11 a.m. ET. The presidential Barbies will be in attendance. #polisky

Very excited to see this in print: we use the German Bundestag to explore gendered gaps in rates of parenthood and show that, especially for mothers, kids correspond with lower likelihood of serving multiple terms --> www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.... gendersky polisky

Please join us on Friday, March 22 at 2pm ET for our online research seminar! This month's topic:  “Is Gender Diplomacy Effective? Quotas and International Perceptions of Democracy in Authoritarian Regimes” by @@771150. 

Register here: docs.google.com/form...

Gendersky Polisky

📢New #PAG20 Book Review📚 @@842818 reviews 'Antigone’s Example' by Mihoko Suzuki. Suzuki draws from the writings of 15 early modern women to argue that civil war presents a critical opportunity for women in intervene in politics. polisky gendersky www.cambridge.org/core/journal...

📢New issue of #PAG20📢 In "Made for Men" Annika Hinze surveys female PhD students and faculty in 🇺🇸 Poli Sci departments about the institutional gender norms they encounter and argues for the importance of critical actors in changing those norms. 
polisky gendersky www.cambridge.org/core/journal...

OK, #PoliSky -- American politics people still grading prelims: Is the current received wisdom that there has been a party realignment after 1932? Please discuss briefly, with citations only if absolutely necessary.
Unfortunately we’ve had to postpone this event and are working to reschedule. Look out for our future announcements! #PolTheory #PoliSky
🚨 New article alert 🚨 @@4111018 PhD alum @@335711 has a new article out on crisis leadership and response speed.

📢New article w C. Plescia in EPSR

We examine people's perceptions of #electoralintegrity in the 2019 #EPelections 🇪🇺 & underlying ext. and int. factors (e.g. EU & populist attitudes). We also test for mediating role of beliefs on #fakenews influence.

A dream come true: Visiting UC Berkeley to give a talk on my current research, hosted by the dept. of sociology and the Eastern European Institute. March 20 12.00 - meet if you're there. Thx to the great @@734742  for the invite events.berkeley.edu/iseees/day/d... 
#sociology #polisky

A lot more comparative polisci books seem to have multiple coauthors than other areas of social science I’ve read in. Some of that seems to be because there’s a specific half dozen or so who work together in some combination a lot and sometimes with additional people. Still interesting
#polisky Watch this and try not to bang your head against a wall...

In-person meetings held at 7 pm on most days tend to favor a very small group of people. Polisci studies in the US have shown that older, whiter, wealthier people attend city council meetings. We had zoom meetings for a while, which allowed those w/childcare obligations to attend. That ended.

polisky polsky
I remember the following anecdote I was told in a class sometime: 
When Louis XIV came to power he instructed his ministers to draw up a list of dynastic claims he could make.
Can anyone give me references to this claim? It'd be very very helpful and much appreciated.

Comparative polisci about different democratic institutional choices is very valuable, but I’ve been surprised by how much better I’ve understood our institutions by understanding the specific struggles and trade-offs that *non-democracies* face. Comparative polisci of those is fascinating

🎙️ How are #populism & political crises interlinked (if at all?). Re-watch this lecture I gave last summer 📺 #europe 🌐

Best friends make the best coauthors! We had a great time at the @@4182789 polisky conference at FSU.

We had some early* pilot results that we got great feedback on. And we got to see (and make) friends & learn about some incredible research!

*fielded 2 weeks before

NEW: My analysis of the 1937 MGM drama A Family Affair, about a judge who opposes a lucrative aqueduct project, despite the developer trying to blackmail him into by threatening to expose his family to scandal. All reposts much appreciated.

Looking for textbook recs for MA-level Intro to Public Administration. Specifically, I am trying to find a good book with comparative focus (i.e. not just US admin). Esp. helpful if there is some disc. of Nordics, but happy for any and all recs! polisky & pasky & academicsky Thx! 🙏
hey polisky - I'll be at MPSA Thurs-Sat! Happy to talk with anyone - free consults, possible opportunities, or just coffee and chat! first name at handle dot com
Starting to plan my ISA 2024 schedule, so any suggestions about interesting panels (or good craft beer/cocktail spots) are very much appreciated. [polisky]

Many thanks to James Long for his very gracious review of my book in Perspectives on Politics. He highlighted what I see as the main strengths and contributions far better and more succinctly than I could have: tinyurl.com/4twnmbfe polisky

Friends, my colleague has an amazing student who got accepted to an Ivy League MA program in international affairs:

A Palestinian, first-gen, Muslim woman.

The cost of the program is prohibitive. Can anyone point me to funding sources that can help cover her tuition?

#menasky #poliscisky

📢 New #PAG20 Book Review 📚 @@593653 
reviews 'Masculinities, Gender and International Relations' by Terrell Carver & Laura Lyddon. The book draws on theory to understand the role of gender and masculinity in the international arms trade polisky gendersky www.cambridge.org/core/journal...

📢New issue of #PAG20 is out!📢 Helen Rabello Kras utilizes an original experiment in 🇧🇷 to understand the relationship between perceptions of the legal system and policy opinions🌟Available #OpenAccess 🌟 polisky gendersky www.cambridge.org/core/journal...

📢 New #PAG20 Book Review 📚 Rania Maktabi reviews 'Women, Money, and Political Participation in the Middle East' by Bozena C. Welborne which explores the impacts of rent, remittance and foreign aid on women's rights in the region.
🌟 #OpenAccess 🌟 polisky gendersky www.cambridge.org/core/journal...

📢New issue of #PAG20 is out!📢 Susanne Zwingel investigates the role of local office holders in the 2015 adoption of a CEDAW ordinance in Miami-Dade county as part of the CEDAW for Cities campaign in 'Women’s Rights Close to Home?' 
🌟#OpenAccess 🌟 polisky gendersky www.cambridge.org/core/journal...

It may just be possible that no amount of improvement in the economy will make voters want Biden.  It's possible that US politics have become subject to the logic of engagement algorithms... we collectively want the more "entertaining" candidate and we'll rationalize our Dionysian impulses. #polisky

Hey Stata polisky / econ folks: Ever make bar graphs? Do your students?

My 2021 book Making the World Safe for Dictatorship is now published as a paperback w/ Oxford University Press. 

To celebrate I will put everyone who reposts this before March 21 into a random drawing & send the winner a free copy anywhere they happen to be in the world.

Don't miss our monthly professional development seminar tomorrow (Friday) at 2pm Eastern. The topic is “Balancing Teaching, Research, and Service at a Liberal Arts College,” featuring panelists Jennifer Garcia and Kaitlin Sidorsky. Register here: docs.google.com/form...

Nuclear Negotiation Simulation in strategy & national security class today. After a week talking about how to make nuclear weapons & US nonpro strategy, we jump to the Star Trek universe to see if the students (representing Federation Planets) can stop the Borg from developing nukes!

APSA Council and officer nominations are assembled by a nominating committee (www.apsanet.org/ABOUT/Govern... ). Suggestions from APSA members influence their deliberations. If you know of people who are APSA members and might be interested, email their names to nominations@apsanet.org

Polisky

If you're interested in Congress at all, and particularly if you're a senior graduate student, recent grad, or faculty within less than 15 years of your PhD--

consider applying for the Congressional Fellowship Program. Happy to answer any questions! 

www.apsanet.org/cfp

Remember, the core principle of Polisky is that your follower count shouldn’t determine your ability to reach the discipline

Polisky is what we make of it. Remember that you can set up your own feed that draws on the Polisky approved-poster list (and you can also add your own approved list to that as well). Here's the Polisci approved list: at://did:plc:kyttpb6um57f4c2wep25lqhq/app.bsky.graph.list/3k2djx2vgyn2x

200 new polisky feed followers in less than 24 hours (and my recollection is that the 24 hours before that also involved a deluge of new folks). You may experience slight delays in being added to the feed right now.
re-upping this for polisky -- how to set up your own feeds with the Polisky approved list

One of the goals, maybe the biggest goal, of Polisky is to more thoroughly democratize social media for academic surfacing and discovery—when you post to Polisky, no matter how many followers you personally have, you will reach the entire community.
Remember, the norm on polisky is, with apologies to Hillel: if you do not promote yourself, who will? If you promote  yourself alone, what are you?

A few quick polisky announcements:
1) Lots of new folks here -- that's great! Remember to "like" the feed if you want to listen as well as talk :)
2) As Polisky grows, you might not always want to talk to the whole list. I've set up two subfeeds that Polisky posters can use for narrower audiences...
job @ William and Mary : IR and East Asia (polisky) jobs.wm.edu/postings/56050

I want to return to a polisky discussion earlier: why should we lend journals Bsky invites instead of giving them first to PhD students/Global South/etc recipients? Fair question, but here's the answer: removing the reasons to stay on X. If professional communities get planted here, that's Good. 1/

Nick and I wrote about how to be original enough in your thesis https://open.substack.com/pub/thesisstatement/p/the-limits-of-originality?r=10tj&utm_medium=ios&utm_campaign=post — tagging as polisky because you could use in your class and because it’s also helpful for grad students
polisci -- this was an interesting read, to me

There's a feed for political science/IR folks to share scholarship and opportunities. (It's like a hashtag.) To post, you need to be on the approved list (which I maintain) and then tag posts w/ "polisci", 🌐, or "polisky".

https://bsky.app/profile/did:plc:kyttpb6um57f4c2wep25lqhq/feed/aaaevewijfbqy

last polisci post for a bit (i am draftin' papers and writin' syllabi): you can customize your feeds so that you have a top-level Political Science feed 

1. follow / like https://bsky.app/profile/did:plc:kyttpb6um57f4c2wep25lqhq/feed/aaaevewijfbqy

2. click on my feeds & pin "Political Science"
You know how to promote: follow https://bsky.app/profile/did:plc:kyttpb6um57f4c2wep25lqhq/feed/aaaevewijfbqy , get added to be able to post, and then tag w/ polisci
Dear political scientists: please promote the hell out of your work, my TBR pile is getting dangerously reasonable (polisci)

another polisci feed related point: this is NOT my personal creation or feed--we do NOT have to be mutuals, friends, besties, whatever: I want this to be a community resource. I'm not gatekeeping! (but abuse = banhammer) https://bsky.app/profile/did:plc:kyttpb6um57f4c2wep25lqhq/feed/aaaevewijfbqy

Update for polisci feed: for typical bsky-related reasons, we're moving to an approved list--if you're an academic or researcher, just flag me and ask to be added (this includes grad students, think tankers, journalists, whatevers) and still use the polisci term

re polisci feed: it was hard to find an image that covered all political science! the democratic hegemony is strong--"politics" and the like returns a lot of voting icons and images on free image sites. but I want the feed to be friendly to all...hence the uber generic icon here...

re-posting my newsletter from this morning to add the term polisci so it shows up on the polisci feed! https://open.substack.com/pub/musgrave/p/yes-it-matters-that-sweden-joined?r=10tj&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=web discussion of public opinion survey experiments and NATO effects

ok political science and international relations folks: if you use the word "polisci" in your tweet (no quotes, just like that) than it will work as a hashtag and you will be posted to the Political Science feed at https://bsky.app/profile/did:plc:kyttpb6um57f4c2wep25lqhq/feed/aaaevewijfbqy

polisci bluesky is only minimally back so let's be real

the last few years of polisci twitter have been pretty dull!
